page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: THE AREA COVERED IN THIS INFORMATION DEALS WITH 12SQ.KM. TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF ROCHDALE TOWN CENTRE. The area is a combination of built up land,agricultural land and moorland. There is little to be found in the way of industry due to the recession and decline of the cotton industry.Many people are employed in the service industries or out of the area. The four 1km. squares in the north are sparsely populated.Wardle and Healey are both linear villages. Between them may be found rough moorland and several dairy farms.Going further south we come to the residential areas and area of light industry bordering on the town centre. The area is serviced by road links to the M62.and the surrounding towns of Oldham,Bury,Littleborough,Middleton and Manchester.
